com.blueparrott.blueparrottsdk

Class BPSdk

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blueparrott.blueparrottsdk.BPSdk

  • public class BPSdk
extends java.lang.Object
    Main BlueParrott SDK class
    Used to get a handle to a BPHeadset object and then use that to connect etc.

    IMPORTANT:
    Before using the SDK, ensure your app has the following permissions : 
      <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH_ADMIN" />

    If you want to allow connection over BLE, then the following additional permissions are required: 
      <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION" />   required for BLE only, on android 6.0 to get at ble https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=189090
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION" />
    We currently recommend you use targetSdkVersion 22 in your build.gradle. If you do not, then you must a) prompt the user at run time for location permission and b) check and ensure that location services are running This is by design according to google https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=189090

    • Method Detail

      • getBPHeadset

        public static final BPHeadset getBPHeadset(android.content.Context context)
        Return handle to BPHeadset object. Calling this is typically the first step in an integration Once you have a handle to a BPHeadset, you can call methods to connect customize and add listeners for events from the headset
        Parameters:
        context -
        Returns:
        BPHeadset object
